comment: My second course with Professor Premus and he's still amazing. He provides walkthroughs for projects that clearly outline expectations for each project and is accessible outside of class if you need help or extensions. It is asynchronous but I love the way he teaches/ lays things out for students. Wish I was able to be taught by him in person.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I had Professor Premus for History of Illustration and I absolutely loved his class; all of the discussions, quizzes and even finals were extremely well laid out and I knew exactly what to do. While I did not personally reach out to him, he made an open space for students to come to him when need be. He was a great professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Took concept art 2 with him and he's ok I guess. Accessible via email usually but has yet to put in a any grade for the 3 projects we've done. Discussions are how you upload your final projects except he doesn't provide any feedback and my peers just pick the same few people to respond to so you might not receive any feedback for any project...

PLEASE take him if you get the chance!! My favorite professor ever! If you put in the effort you will definitely get an A. He has a good mix of work and fun, and gives lots of good real world advice about the industry. I highly recommend talking to him before/after class too, just to hang out! He always gives great feedback too!

100% the best Professor I have ever had, he makes it so easy to learn. He gives good feedback during critique and takes the time to go through anything you need help with. His class is always entertaining and the assignment deadlines/requirements are reasonable. He gives room for exploration and creativity and good industry resources.
